detailContent.detailText: Apollonion Palace is a luxury hotel in Syros. The logo and a business card was provided as a starting point for the design. the site is emporewed by techiniques of quick loading and a structure that will simplify a CMS implementation.
the about section offers a quick contact form embodying all error preventing messages needed
the gallery of the rooms designed to be flexible to all text-sizes and number of photos for later alterations and additions
photos can be further zoomed in by clicking to reveal the original size photo in a new window
The room availability sections takes care of the proper filling of the fields
search results returned after input of a date margin. easy access to room information and photo gallery
preview of the booking receipt with all input information to be mailed to customer also available for printing
K Studios is a rent-rooms facility in beautiful Chalkidiki, Greece. A straightforward design is always welcomed by all types of users that may use the site.
the room and outdoor spaces gallery is selfexplanatory. little flower decoration prevents appearence of void spaces and gives visual closure.
a page dedicated to the village includes usufull information such as phones of transportation and medical aid. a back to top button scrolls smoothly to top with an animation
the contact and booking form give focus to the fields filled in already
upon filling in the dates of arrival and departure a customized calendar makes the task just two clicks away
fabricaudio is a recording and post production studio located in Athens. This site is their new official website.
the services and pricing page featuring an horizontal structure and dynamic elements of navigation and space availability
graphic elements available for functional use at the sides of the main content
contact page with vibible feedback and dynamic error prevention
gallery of the construction process with implemented visibillity and navigation tools
graphic elements within the music concept
information tooltips on the studio's team members and driving directions appearing on hover
biri biri is a funk band of -at least- 9 musicians coming from greece. The band's logo was given to us to be integrated within a playfull website
moving from the initial page to the inner content the site implements sliding animation as the content unfolds
piece of graphical work done on the individual pages' backgrounds
the band's photo gallery, a wall of polaroid pictures
the page with the band's posters of events
the guestbook's text fields
the contact page
outRandom is an innovative interactive game that deals with people's randomness. geometrical simplicity was a priority in this design.
the menu is implemented so as to appear within a short animation withdrawn with snapshots from the game itself.
additional dynamic menu for the separate exhibitions the installation has been presented at.
a sub-menu unfolded over animation
different stages of the menu as the game creatures reveal or withdraw themselves.
visual simplicity at the contact button as well
delivericious [updated version] is essentially a search engine of restaurants that deliver in a specific area of athens. technologies used : XHTML, CSS, XML, JavaScript and PHP
as a web service delivericious incorporates help tools for the users. Tooltips appear when an error has occured for best guidance of the user.
a list of available restaurants is returned by the engine. Results are filtered by food-type, area and time.
filter tools are provided for refined access on the results e.g. by alpphabetical order, order by type and filter specific type
shop catalogues open on request in a new dragable window. overview of multiple catalogues simultaneusly is possible.
the selected catalogue-items get added in the order note-paper, a visual metaphor of traditional taverna's note-receipts, which includes the calculated total cost of the order.
order notes do not get lost after window closure embodying also the shops essential information. multiple note-paper review is also possible
windows can be minified in a stack on the left bottom of the screen for easy later retrieval.
wreckDiving hosts the research and underwater photos of a group of divers.
a gallery is implemented for a photo overview..
dark background in accordance to the concept of sea depths
anasilian's portfolio
the main site-space is highlightened with the use of an opaque surfice-layer.
logo on the bottom
flower design detail in the home page.
illustration for the download link in the about page.
the work page. A vertical alignment of the different categories.
personal photo in the about page
tictag is innovative search engine for related concepts of a term.
the tictag project's website functions as an introduction to its concepts and functionalities.
one of logos placed at a descrete corner.
logo's different versions illustrated in different pages.
a siple vertical navigation bar implemeted with photographs and fast responce developing techniques.
contact form in the site's colours.
fabricaudio is a recording and post production studio located in Athens. This site hosts an extensive gallery of the studio's construction process.
a dynamic note in the initial page invites to enter.
the architect's map featuring on the background of the site.
functional elements are carefully integrated following the design's visual lines.
within the main gallery. the logo links to team members' information.
navigation buttons to other gallery pages.
the team's 'fancy-box' powered page.
boose is video blog with a large collection of media art related topics
logo designed in collaboration of b, x, and t.
comment form enhanced with note-book lines.
the about page.
use of shadows give visual depth and enhance the feeling of dealing with card shaped posts.
functionalities such as the newsletter and a random post suggestion.
the cubic-cloud portfolio case.
the home page welcomes the viewer. Tooltip is creatively used for extra photo info on the portfolio's owner.
every page features an abstract photo in black and white.
within the portfolio page a javascript code toggles the different categories to reveal their content. Tooltips again used for extra visual information.
carefully selected photo featured in the contact section of the site.
the contact form
oksia is a production company that manufactures greek traditional wooden chairs. The site is a demonstration of the product line.
simplicity is an underling quality dictated by the site's goals and user group's needs.
the logo.
category visual notation.
contact page and information.
on-page gallery opens for better view of the products.
fabricaudio is a recording and post production studio located in Athens. Along with the design and development of their web-site, we designed the company's business card.
Black and red with greyish details in the card's background.
Simplicity on the back side of the card.
Different view.
Different view.
Figos is a wooden-furniture constructor and supplier. Their site aims at the professional presentation of the company and its products through a modern, fresh business site.
Photography and graphical work on the header.
Link to map and driving directions to the companiy's facilities.
Link in the footer leading to advertisment brochure in pdf created by us.
The about page of the company with a quick cycle-gallery of the construction and the company's infrastructure.
Short contact message in the front page, emphasized link to the products gallery and vertical introductory product overview.
Featured products in the product gallery of the site.
Thumbnail navigation in the product gallery.
Contact form with the characteristic highlight in the fields filled in at the moment.
The company requested to be registered to the google maps along with photos of its products.
Short description in the google maps registration.
Αmong the ants is a non-profit company that aims to organise street art festivals and help artists to network.
The site's footer.
The site's header.
Contact form with map to the company's offices.
Amnesty International renewed their site with paramana.com. The site uses a wordpress CMS with a theme and widgets for the needs of the organisation.
Front page: Dynamic content with the news and the press releases of Amnesty International.
Front page: Dynamic content with the new products of the shop.
Front page: Dynamic calendar showing the forthcoming events.
Internal structure of the site's pages.
Dynamic sidebar including featured post and calendar.
The shop page gallery, with overview per category and link to more information.
Shop item page with zoom-in feature.
Contact page with form.
Embedding of call out and request forms in the relevant posts.
'News and Events' page with dynamic text boxes, list of chronologically ordered list and category buttons for refinement of the list.
Άλλη προοπτική.
